intro: Serapias pseudocordigera var. mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritanian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand hot, dry conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
